Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In St Agnes, the crew is involved in a race against time to rescue two young men. They are reported to be struggling in the water near a notorious headland known as Tubby's Head. In Whitby, North Yorkshire, Leah is training to be the station's first female helm, and her skills are put to the test when she is called out to rescue a walker who's fallen and injured her leg on inaccessible rocks by the seal colony at Ravenscar.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Northern Ireland serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. Their vegan starters include a celebration of mushrooms inspired by the Northern Ireland animated film Wolfwalkers and an artichoke tart playing tribute to the Gruffalo trail in Belfast. Among the fish dishes are two based on Puffin Rock - one with pan-fried cod, the other an elevated version of fish, chips and curry sauce - as well as a sea trout with buttermilk sauce celebrating the illustrations in The Fog Catcher's Daughter.

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba.

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the comedy panel game, in which things just didn't go according to plan. Hosted by Sandi Toksvig, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?.

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Ally takes Dave with her when she attends her sister's wedding, where she is due to give the maid of honour speech. Meanwhile, Mike is trying to finalise Dave's first record deal on the very same weekend.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer.

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis.

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.sub-title: My Hindu Coming Out Story - Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The diving team get a late call from a boat in peril. A missing lifeboat cannister means a ferry is unable to sail, causing chaos for the passengers that use the service for their daily commute. It's a needle-in-a-haystack hunt in near-zero visibility - and to make matters worse, local leisure cruisers create imminent danger for the diver underwater.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Ishy Balmer visits the first Jain temple in the western world and Izzie Khan discovers the history of folk art. Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, who's front of house. It's the Bikers' job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine.

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom..

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond.

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the fourth round of fixtures, including Leigh Leopards v St Helens, Leeds Rhinos v Wakefield Trinity and Hull FC v Salford Red Devils.

programme.title: First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Recorded coverage as First Minister Mark Drakeford answers questions from MSs from the Senedd in Cardiff Bay.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton.

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: Wildlife in America's mountain regions, including the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada, areas infamous for extremes of temperature from freezing winters to scorching summers. The programme examines the survival strategies employed by animals including black bears, pikas and bison, as well as parasitic plants. Plus, a look at the challenges faced by these region's human inhabitants, including ranchers leading their cattle on 70-mile journeys.

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents another selection of choice moments from the long-running series. The show's specialists recall the difficulties that arose while recording episodes in Europe, and Andy McConnell remembers a glass artist with a difference.

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer provides everyday cooking advice, demonstrating recipes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: A stroll through Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve in southern Colorado, where strange lights, animal mutilations and other bizarre incidents have been spotted.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: Reports of odd sightings at Lassen Volcanic National Park, in California, which include reptiles - known as reptoids - who work with aliens and can appear in human form.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: Dan Abrams introduces some of the most dramatic outbursts and extraordinary moments to ever take place in US courtrooms.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: As series two continues, Dan Abrams revisits the most dramatic outbursts and extraordinary moments to ever take place in US courtroom.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Gator season may be over but Troy Landry is still battling monsters in the swamp. A snake invasion is threatening the community and Troy calls in some friends to help him track down the sinister Voodoo Python.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Tatton Park, Cheshire, sort the treasures from their trash. Items include a collection of crockery, jewellery and ornaments, which ensure the dealers get their cash out to tempt the sellers. Plus, a selection of Coronation Street autographs shows up on James Layte's table.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy's paltry gifts are no match for Cindy's foul mood at an auction.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a collection of James Bond movie trading cards, while a seller brings in an old Chinese bell. Later, Chum and Antwaun set sail on a trip to Lake Tahoe to check out a vintage sailboat. Will the sail withstand the perils of negotiation or sink to the depths of no return?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Buddy, Can You Spare a Thousand?
programme.desc: Rick considers buying a rare $1,000 banknote - and is willing to spend $10,000 to get his hands on it.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rap artist Flavor Flav brings in an OJ Simpson statue and is asking for six-figures, but it remains to be seen whether he will get what he wants.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have insisted that simple stones can do everything from choosing a king to causing death. The actor-presenter considers what it is about rocks and stones that inspires some people to worship them.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Chile has the highest number of UFO sightings of anywhere on Earth. Here, incredible footage of a strange craft has people asking again about the reasons why.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Stone Giants
programme.desc: From Egypt to Easter Island, towering figures built by ancient man stand watch over Earth - but do they depict visitors from another world?.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective Investigations
programme.desc: The Thornhill buyers run for cover when a self-help CD gives Roy a new lease on his egomaniacal life.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello cannot wait to see what he can drum up this time around. Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it. Kenny does his best to fire up his profits, while Brandi can't see the potential in the units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura are on the hunt for better units and better buyers. Rene tries to capitalise on warehouse sales and nabs a deal..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick heads to Los Angeles for a shopping spree, where he views props from Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory and a painting by actor Leonardo DiCaprio.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chumlee take a trip to Florida to check out a 1964 Rybovich yacht, and later check out a polling machine from the 2000 presidential election.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick calls in a surprise expert to value a Ronald McDonald balloon inflator, and Corey takes a stab at purchasing a vintage spear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. All hell breaks loose when Ashley puts a rare Olympic torch from Seth's personal collection up for sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley faces the consequences of her rash decision, Seth takes a ride in a hovercraft and Les does business with Muhammad Ali Jr.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The family decides to hold a father-daughter sales competition after Ashley steals a deal from right under Les's nose.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Les challenges Seth to sell all the new items within a week after he learns that his son has spent thousands of dollars at a sports card auction.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: New evidence reveals advanced civilisations might have existed on Earth thousands of years ago - is it possible that they lived with extraterrestrials?.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In numerous ancient cultures, stories were told of ancestors from the Pleiades star cluster. This programme considers whether new scientific findings may reveal the truth.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Dogs have a fine sense of smell in a conventional way, but it has been suggested they can also 'smell' disease. One dog owner's husky, Sierra, was able to detect cancer long before her doctor. However, scientists still aren't sure how Sierra could possibly have done it, prompting Shatner to contemplate whether a more mysterious sixth sense is at play.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Back in Montebello, Brandi and her buddy set the wayback machine and discover a roaring good time. Darrell makes the most of the little he's got, while Kenny fills his piggy bank, while courting an unfamiliar pastime.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy brings his son to Moreno Valley, where good things always happen, and leaves with yo-yos of an unexpected kind. Rene and Casey discover that their shoes are more 'air' and less 'Jordan'. Kenny tries to level up his locker, while Lisa learns to look beyond the trash.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by antiques dealers Ian Towning and David Ford in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, to offer locals the chance to put their items up for auction or accept a cash sum. The highlight of the day is a large collection of Spode ceramic pieces.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Tom and Nancy create a masterpiece out of a raw wolf hide, while Eustace teaches his neighbours how to put food on the table and Mike heads to Whale Island.

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers
programme.desc: Mike converts a 1957 GMC truck to run on alcohol for a truck-obsessed teenage girl. Avery goes the extra mile, finishing the Unimog for its hard-to-please owner.

programme.title: Swamp Mysteries with Troy Landry
programme.desc: The swamp expert embarks on a mission to protect locals from an unknown beast who lurks in a mysterious bayou in Louisiana.

programme.desc: Mike's special date with Iris is interrupted when the raccoons get fleas and head over to Mike's to find something to relieve their itchiness..

programme.sub-title: Lost in the Lost City of Atlantis

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. There's a sports championship at the local stadium - the competition is the kids' chance to win a medal. If they do, they could be as popular as top athlete Flavio Tamaley, but it's been ages since they've done any sports - however, the championship is a competition for babies... but as there are no age limits in the rules, our intrepid trio decide to join in and to try to win every event on offer..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to be as popular as Santa Claus, Fizz leaves presents on everyone's doorsteps. But Magoo has launched Operation Clean Streets and throws away Fizz's presents, thinking he's cleaning up..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. As an anniversary treat, Gena has booked a private performance by Dolichovsky, Malcolm's favourite actor - Lloyd is entrusted with preparing the apple for the snail's arrival, but Dolichovsky proves to be far more demanding than expected..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. After his inattention causes a mid-flight collision with Polly, Lloyd must attend a 'flight awareness' course run by Molly - if he refuses, he risks being grounded and will therefore have to walk everywhere!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Gran sits in front of the television for so long that she turns into a cocoon, and with a little help from Dave - who wants his favourite seat back - she hatches into a moth. When Moth-Gran sets her sights on the moon, it's up to the Spuds to find a way to entice her back..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave and his friend Zombie Katie are working on a school project together about endangered animals, so George takes them on an expedition to the local park to see what they can find. There they discover the much-fabled Beast of Grimsby - and Dave must decide between a gold star at school and the future of the beast..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Driving outside Shreveport, Louisiana, our gang of mystery solvers is run off the road by a shooting star that crashes down in the middle of the large ranch belonging to none-other than famous football hall of famer and TV sports host, Terry Bradshaw. Upon further investigation, the 'shooting star' turns out to be a spaceship unleashing an alien monster on the local countryside! The gang and Mr. Bradshaw work together to get to the bottom of this space alien mystery and figure out what this alien is really after - championship rings or giant doughnuts.

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: Roger gets help from his annoying neighbours to move house, and it doesn't matter if he wants to move or not..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Our Shaggy is a bit of a Beatnik poet (but only when no one is around) and Scooby is so proud that he enters Shaggy into a poetry slam contest in Central Park. But when Shaggy finds out he's going up against famous singer-songwriter Halsey he just about freaks. He freaks even more when the poetry slam is attacked by a horrible gator-man-monster from the NYC sewers below!.

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Tata is always developing machines - this time he sets about making an orange juice machine. After a lot of trial and error, he finally succeeds, but when Tata squeezes a drop of orange juice with some effort, Kuma passes by and squeezes an orange so easily with his hand that Tata becomes discouraged..

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows 10-year-old Craig Williams and his two friends, Kelsey and John Paul, as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek which acts as a utopia where children reign.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid: Revenge of the Spider Queen
programme.desc: A special episode of the series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The ancient and evil Spider Queen emerges from her lair - with the help of a shadowy figure, she is supercharged and uses her power to capture the Monkey King and the Demon Bull King. Monkie Kid and his friends team up with Red Son to track down ingredients from the Celestial Realm for an antidote to cure the city's citizens and free it from her destruction..

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: Overlord helps Weaver with morning announcements and uses the opportunity to hypnotize the adults at school. Jim drags Willow to 'Bring Your Daughter to Work Day'.

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec is really excited about going to see her favourite band The Easels in concert but is finding it hard to stay calm - she comes up with a soothing Takeaway technique that involves printing with cling film, and also gets a call from a customer who needs help with a bathroom disaster. Bec also creates a 'Blast Off' space game with just three ingredients, and she surprises some very friendly neighbours....

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless buffoon heads out on a camping trip, but his knowledge of wild animals proves less than worthy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The inimitable Bean tracks down the men responsible for kidnapping his teddy - only to find he is not their only captive.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Shocking Showdown of the Staggering Sugamechanger
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. It's Parents' Weekend at Lake Summer Camp - with his job in danger, Krupp tries to make peace with George and Harold and get their parents to sign them up for next summer, but the boys have had enough and form an uneasy alliance with Melvin to take down Krupp - until Krupp actually turns the camp around and makes it awesome!.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated adventures. Skates and Pythor are busy digging in the Sea of Sand as Pythor is searching for the lost city of Ouroboros - said to be the prison of the Great Devourer.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is fed up: Mo cannot be relied on, and they're meant to be working as a team for a school presentation. Sam asks the Sceptre for the power to change her brother in a bid to make him behave more responsibly, but the Sceptre goes wonky and interprets Sam's request literally: John-Cedrick is her new half-brother! To make matters worse, the Sceptre is shattered, and as Wanda explains to Sam, you can never ever request a power that works against your own sibling....

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Selina is rehearsing her speech for a prestigious podiatrist convention - Mo fools around in her pair of prototype orthopaedic cowboy boots, takes them off and leaves the room - when he comes back, the cowboy boots are gone, and there are no witnesses apart from a house plant. Mo invokes the power to communicate with plants and leads an investigation with Sam and the house plant, a ficus that proves to have a fickle personality!.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Scooby and Shaggy meet up with their biker buddy, Axl Rose, on a tour of famous roadside diners along iconic Route 66..

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. A fair is in town and everyone's talking about one of the rides - Maximum Delirium, a figure-of-eight that freaks them all out. Nobody has ever ridden on it three times in a row as it seems totally impossible... but not for our heroes. If the kids manage it, they'll be the coolest dudes in town hands down!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To become more popular, Fizz creates a useful robot designed to service the residents of the city. But when his android picks up Marnie's misplaced handkerchief, Magoo gets jealous and believes he has a rival for her affections..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Having written a book on the subject, Gena agrees to train Lloyd in how to survive outdoors, but Lloyd is disappointed to discover that all the training is to take place indoors..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Abacus is targeted by The Louse Hunter, a ruthless louse spider who loves the thrill of the hunt, Lloyd steps up to the challenge of protecting his best friend. On this occasion, however, Abacus may not need his help....

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave enters Fuzzypeg into a competition to become the face of a new brand of dog food which he unexpectedly wins, but as Fuzzypeg embarks on a glamorous new lifestyle, Dave misses his pal and seeks a way to terminate his contract..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Gran buys a new loo which looks strikingly similar to the previously encountered Chaos Toilet - this lavatory has a tendency to flush its users into another dimension, and Dave and Gran quickly find themselves flushed and spat out in olden-day Grimsby. Here the Queen of Grimsby has a bone to pick with Gran....

programme.title: Inspector Gadget

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: When Overlord enlists the family to look for an object he misplaced one year ago, he leads the Underwoods to recount the first day he arrived at their home.

programme.title: Dodo
programme.desc: Wickedly sharp animated series following a boy navigating the dramas and pitfalls of Year 7 and trying to fit in. When Joe proudly unveils his 12 Today! birthday badge at school, the kids suddenly turn into zombies, all moving towards him and repeating 'birthday' in an ominous way - just then, Frisbo grabs Joe and explains about birthday beats. With everyone getting to hit him once on the arm for every year, Joe reckons that with 12 years and 1500 kids, that must mean a million hits for him....

programme.title: Dodo
programme.desc: Wickedly sharp animated series following a boy navigating the dramas and pitfalls of Year 7 and trying to fit in. Everyone at school seems to have found love apart from Joe - Pete is going out with Charlotte George, and even Frisbo says that he's going out with someone. Frisbo tells Joe he should get a girlfriend too, but the only problem is who he should choose. However, when Hot Molly walks into class, Joe decides that he will choose her because of her popularity. How will he win her over?.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. programme.title: Untold: From Rap to Riches
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how UK rappers such as Lady Leshurr, Wretch 32 and Krep are following in the footsteps of their US counterparts by turning their hands to big business, becoming entrepreneurs in the world of baby skincare, vodka and CBD products. They discuss how their music platform feeds into their brand, and their wish to be the first in their families to leave a legacy of generational wealth.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Psychotic Sideshow Bob is released from Springfield Penitentiary thirsting for revenge - prompting Bart and the rest of the family to join the witness protection programme. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer.

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Husband and wife Dave and Pam kick off the competition in Gloucestershire with a farmhouse menu, as they compete against Alettia and Stuart, and Jake and Helen for the cash prize.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows a project by artists Freddie Robins and Ben Coode-Adams to convert a large, Grade II-listed timber-framed barn in Essex into a family home and workspace. Their plans involve a minimal number of interior walls to display their collection of toys, but at seven times the size of an average three-bedroom house, the transformation of the 500-year-old building proves extremely challenging.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits a property in Yorkshire which is part Victorian stone farmhouse and part brick extension, with interiors that are outdated and in need of renovating. Meanwhile in Buckinghamshire, George meets the owners of an 18th century gatehouse who need help changing the layout of their living room.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with house-hunters from previous episodes for whom space was a decisive issue. In East Lothian, he visits Ian, who wanted a workshop for his collection of vehicles and spare parts, while in Wolverhampton, he drops in on Darren and Me'sha, who wanted room for a recording studio.

programme.title: Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On
programme.desc: Jamie makes the most of leftover Easter lamb with a traybake biryani, and makes scruffy aubergine lasagne and comforting hungover noodles.

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and the team help Glaswegians Christine and Chris, first-time buyers who have run out of money to decorate their tenement flat.

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and the team help Glaswegians Christine and Chris, first-time buyers who have run out of money to decorate their tenement flat.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game with Ore Oduba joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary's investigation jeopardises the aliens' mission, Don disappoints Sally and the Big Giant Head brings bad news.

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part Two
programme.desc: Last-ever episode. With their mission over, the aliens prepare to leave Earth - but Dick finds himself unable to abandon Mary and wonders if she might join him in outer space. John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Kristen Johnston star.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is stunned when God seemingly grants her prayers for a pay rise - so starts putting in more, far-from-spiritual requests with the Almighty. Doug tries to talk her out of it but, with an important football game on the horizon, he decides he could do with a bit of divine intervention himself.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug coaches a kids' football team, but is persuaded by Deacon's son to take up the sport himself. Though Carrie is impressed with his new determination to get into shape, he soon realises how unfit he has become once he takes to the field.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur grows jealous of a new dog on Holly's route, and Doug envies Carrie's close relationship with a gay colleague, deciding to spend more time with Deacon to get even with her. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier are forced to spend time together while trying to convince the headmaster of an exclusive Boston school that their precocious son Frederick would be the ideal pupil. Comedy, guest starring Bebe Neuwirth.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Our Father Whose Art Ain't Heaven
programme.desc: Martin feel indebted to Frasier and buys him an expensive work of art to repay his hospitality - but the gesture is not appreciated. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Dad Loves Sherry, the Boys Just Whine
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier take an instant dislike to Martin's new girlfriend Sherry, a brash barmaid at McGinty's - but hide their feelings for fear of offending him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Sharon John, the president and CEO of Build-a-Bear Workshop, goes undercover in her company to work alongside the employees who custom-build stuffed animals in retail outlets and shops, and who work in the distribution warehouse and shipping department.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes headlines and weather.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics fly to the aid of mountain biker Rob in the Cumbrian mountains. Off-road motorbiker Dean is set to miss his friend's 50th birthday celebrations after taking a nasty tumble. Plus, 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields.

programme.title: Steph's Packed Lunch
programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents the weekday magazine, including celebrity guests, food ideas, real-life features and entertainment, lifestyle and consumer stories. Plus, a sideways look at the news in One O'Clock Views.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game, with Pat Nevin joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Tool Club
programme.desc: The team continue the rescue of a community allotment in Preston. Kevin teaches Pat how to transform a wheelbarrow and Julia helps Mark to upholster some old chairs. At the home build, Jess and Max attempt to reimagine an unused space to the satisfaction of the owners and their pooches. Local resident Mark visits the Tool Bus to see if the team can help him revive a childhood toy.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There is a new arrival at the alpaca farm in France, security problems plague the padel tennis club in Spain while the pool finally has water at the rock 'n' roll B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Georgia and Paul invite the B&Bers into The Shuckburgh Arms in Stoke Doyle. The guests are amazed by the converted barns but things hit a snag when not everyone sleeps soundly. Michael complains of a broken fridge disturbing his slumber but by feedback time, Georgia and Paul are confident they've done enough to be victorious on payment day.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Huddersfield is supermarket worker Ann-Marie, who's looking to woo her guests with an evening of fancy Italian nosh and some saucy and crazy concoctions.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer recalls his musical heyday as a member of the Be Sharps barbershop quartet, when he performed for President Reagan along with Principal Skinner, Barney and Apu. Featuring the voices of David Crosby and George Harrison.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Co-Party Leader Carla Denyer gives the Green Party view on Bristol as an increasingly green city.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton finds out if there is any difference between soft and crusty bread rolls, and Andi Oliver reveals why chocolate chips don't melt when baked in cookies. Andi also asks why pre-made sandwiches always seem to have mayonnaise in them, Matt Tebbutt uncovers some of the secrets of ready meals and Briony May Williams discovers the surprising science of how canned food can last so long.

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: A look at Paula Yates' career as a writer, the importance of motherhood to her persona, the criticisms she faced and how she coped in the aftermath of Michael Hutchence's death. Featuring recordings of personal interviews with her from Martin Townsend in which she opened up about grief, family issues and her efforts to get help ahead of her death due to accidental heroin overdose in 2000

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie teams up with her mum and sister to create a Barbie-inspired office, and calls in professional help to declutter and downsize her wardrobe. Her protection dog Blade is sent back to school for some extra guard dog training, but when a flood hits the home the renovations are at risk.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Anthony is rushed to resus after coming off his motor scooter on his 18th birthday. Doctors are concerned that he has internal bleeding. Sixteen-year-old Jack is urgently transferred from another hospital with multiple fractures and nerve damage in his arm after he fell off his electric scooter. After twisting his ankle at school, 13-year-old Josh has been brought to the emergency department by his father, Sanjay, who explains how he left India for the UK to pursue a career as a chef.

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Vogue Williams meets porn star, Skyler who believes bigger buttocks could boost her career and beauty therapist, Bianca who wants to bring her boobs under control. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?.

programme.title: Untold: From Rap to Riches
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how UK rappers such as Lady Leshurr, Wretch 32 and Krep are following in the footsteps of their US counterparts by turning their hands to big business, becoming entrepreneurs in the world of baby skincare, vodka and CBD products. programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows a project by artists Freddie Robins and Ben Coode-Adams to convert a large, Grade II-listed timber-framed barn in Essex into a family home and workspace. Their plans involve a minimal number of interior walls to display their collection of toys, but at seven times the size of an average three-bedroom house, the transformation of the 500-year-old building proves extremely challenging.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits a property in Yorkshire which is part Victorian stone farmhouse and part brick extension, with interiors that are outdated and in need of renovating. Meanwhile in Buckinghamshire, George meets the owners of an 18th century gatehouse who need help changing the layout of their living room.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with house-hunters from previous episodes for whom space was a decisive issue. In East Lothian, he visits Ian, who wanted a workshop for his collection of vehicles and spare parts, while in Wolverhampton, he drops in on Darren and Me'sha, who wanted room for a recording studio.

programme.title: Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On
programme.desc: Jamie makes the most of leftover Easter lamb with a traybake biryani, and makes scruffy aubergine lasagne and comforting hungover noodles.

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and the team help Glaswegians Christine and Chris, first-time buyers who have run out of money to decorate their tenement flat.

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and the team help Glaswegians Christine and Chris, first-time buyers who have run out of money to decorate their tenement flat.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game with Ore Oduba joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary's investigation jeopardises the aliens' mission, Don disappoints Sally and the Big Giant Head brings bad news.

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part Two
programme.desc: Last-ever episode. With their mission over, the aliens prepare to leave Earth - but Dick finds himself unable to abandon Mary and wonders if she might join him in outer space. John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Kristen Johnston star.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is stunned when God seemingly grants her prayers for a pay rise - so starts putting in more, far-from-spiritual requests with the Almighty. Doug tries to talk her out of it but, with an important football game on the horizon, he decides he could do with a bit of divine intervention himself.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug coaches a kids' football team, but is persuaded by Deacon's son to take up the sport himself. Though Carrie is impressed with his new determination to get into shape, he soon realises how unfit he has become once he takes to the field.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur grows jealous of a new dog on Holly's route, and Doug envies Carrie's close relationship with a gay colleague, deciding to spend more time with Deacon to get even with her. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier are forced to spend time together while trying to convince the headmaster of an exclusive Boston school that their precocious son Frederick would be the ideal pupil. Comedy, guest starring Bebe Neuwirth.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Our Father Whose Art Ain't Heaven
programme.desc: Martin feel indebted to Frasier and buys him an expensive work of art to repay his hospitality - but the gesture is not appreciated. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Dad Loves Sherry, the Boys Just Whine
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier take an instant dislike to Martin's new girlfriend Sherry, a brash barmaid at McGinty's - but hide their feelings for fear of offending him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Sharon John, the president and CEO of Build-a-Bear Workshop, goes undercover in her company to work alongside the employees who custom-build stuffed animals in retail outlets and shops, and who work in the distribution warehouse and shipping department.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes headlines and weather.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics fly to the aid of mountain biker Rob in the Cumbrian mountains. Off-road motorbiker Dean is set to miss his friend's 50th birthday celebrations after taking a nasty tumble. Plus, 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields.

programme.title: Steph's Packed Lunch
programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents the weekday magazine, including celebrity guests, food ideas, real-life features and entertainment, lifestyle and consumer stories. Plus, a sideways look at the news in One O'Clock Views.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game, with Pat Nevin joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Tool Club
programme.desc: The team continue the rescue of a community allotment in Preston. Kevin teaches Pat how to transform a wheelbarrow and Julia helps Mark to upholster some old chairs. At the home build, Jess and Max attempt to reimagine an unused space to the satisfaction of the owners and their pooches. Local resident Mark visits the Tool Bus to see if the team can help him revive a childhood toy.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There is a new arrival at the alpaca farm in France, security problems plague the padel tennis club in Spain while the pool finally has water at the rock 'n' roll B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Georgia and Paul invite the B&Bers into The Shuckburgh Arms in Stoke Doyle. The guests are amazed by the converted barns but things hit a snag when not everyone sleeps soundly. Michael complains of a broken fridge disturbing his slumber but by feedback time, Georgia and Paul are confident they've done enough to be victorious on payment day.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Huddersfield is supermarket worker Ann-Marie, who's looking to woo her guests with an evening of fancy Italian nosh and some saucy and crazy concoctions.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer recalls his musical heyday as a member of the Be Sharps barbershop quartet, when he performed for President Reagan along with Principal Skinner, Barney and Apu. Featuring the voices of David Crosby and George Harrison.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: The Political Slot
programme.desc: Co-Party Leader Carla Denyer gives the Green Party view on Bristol as an increasingly green city.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton finds out if there is any difference between soft and crusty bread rolls, and Andi Oliver reveals why chocolate chips don't melt when baked in cookies. Andi also asks why pre-made sandwiches always seem to have mayonnaise in them, Matt Tebbutt uncovers some of the secrets of ready meals and Briony May Williams discovers the surprising science of how canned food can last so long.

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: A look at Paula Yates' career as a writer, the importance of motherhood to her persona, the criticisms she faced and how she coped in the aftermath of Michael Hutchence's death. Featuring recordings of personal interviews with her from Martin Townsend in which she opened up about grief, family issues and her efforts to get help ahead of her death due to accidental heroin overdose in 2000

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie teams up with her mum and sister to create a Barbie-inspired office, and calls in professional help to declutter and downsize her wardrobe. Her protection dog Blade is sent back to school for some extra guard dog training, but when a flood hits the home the renovations are at risk.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Anthony is rushed to resus after coming off his motor scooter on his 18th birthday. Doctors are concerned that he has internal bleeding. Sixteen-year-old Jack is urgently transferred from another hospital with multiple fractures and nerve damage in his arm after he fell off his electric scooter. After twisting his ankle at school, 13-year-old Josh has been brought to the emergency department by his father, Sanjay, who explains how he left India for the UK to pursue a career as a chef.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Chris finds himself on the tail of a runaway Renault. The car is flying and when it hurtles round a blind bend, it rolls onto its roof.

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling.

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at some of the most famous railway stations in cities around the world, catching up with staff, maintenance crews, passengers and transport police. The first episode focuses on Grand Central and Penn stations in New York, and features a terminal manager coping with a series of crises and a police officer and her dog on the hunt for explosive devices.

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Howrah Terminal in Calcutta, which is the busiest station in India and serves one of the fastest growing cities on Earth. Monday morning rush hour sees ticket inspector Pranab braving a tide of morning commuters pouring out from the platforms as he seeks out fare dodgers, while a signal failure halts the progress of the most prestigious service on the entire Indian network in the form of the Rajdhani Express, the luxury overnight train from Calcutta to Delhi.

programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: On a New Forest farm, twin lambs of the rare Valais Blacknose breed are born, but the second lamb is rejected by his mother and his life seems to be taking a different path to that of his sister. Meanwhile, African elephant calf Nusu is growing up fast, but cannot quite master all of his various appendages, and when he tries to run on muddy ground, he ends up in a heap. Elsewhere, Oberon the Lusitano foal learns the art of dressage, hoping to follow in the hoofsteps of his father and become an Olympic champion.

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker sets out to view rare wild vampire bats in the forests of Costa Rica, determined to dispel some of the myths surrounding them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Animation for younger viewers following the adventures of the cheeky piglet, her brother George and their friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George and Daddy are in the garden painting a picture of a cherry tree when the ducks run through the paint and all over their masterpiece.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig builds a train called Gertrude and takes George and Peppa for a ride.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George visit their cousin Chloe and her new baby brother.

programme.title: Blue's Clues & You
programme.desc: Blue and friends make shapes in the snow and sing a snow day song.

programme.title: Oggy Oggy
programme.desc: Oggy Oggy exaggerates with SuperCat's SuperSignal, calling over and over for help without good reason.

programme.title: Odo
programme.desc: Shirley the Chicken is unbeatable at the game of Bird Statues - until she comes up against Odo.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy Fire Station is opened to the public and Norman is eager to try things out, crawling under safety tape and getting into the driving seat of a fire engine. However, his inquisitive nature and desire for excitement lead to danger when he climbs onto the roof to get closer to Tom and his helicopter.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends: All Engines Go!
programme.desc: A younger Thomas the Tank Engine goes on adventures with all of his friends as they work on the island of Sodor.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Charlene swims too close to the beach for the third time in a week, so Neville builds a shark-spotting drone - which quickly makes the lifeguards obsolete.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa's playgroup are making masks and there are carrot, robot and even pretty butterfly ones, the only thing missing is lots and lots of glitter.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig and Grandad Dog take Peppa, George and Danny bowling. Peppa, George and Grandpa Pig have never been before.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save an Out-of-Control Mini Patrol
programme.desc: Adventure following a squad of six heroic puppies and their tech-savvy 10-year-old leader as they protect the community of Adventure Bay.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: When spirited rabbit Pip tries to help sweet-natured mouse Posy, he cannot help showing off his roller skating skills - making Posy give up altogether. Pip has to find a way to get her back on her skates.

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington
programme.desc: Thanks to the Brown family, Paddington takes off and becomes the world's first bearonaut.

programme.title: Milo
programme.desc: Lofty, Milo and Lark work in a supermarket.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Moto Pups: Pups Save the Donuts
programme.desc: The Ruff-Ruff Pack steals Mr Porter's Mini-Donut Maker, so the Moto Pups set off to get the machine back in one piece.

programme.title: Daisy & Ollie
programme.sub-title: What Is the Perfect Birthday Present for My Daddy?
programme.desc: The postman arrives with lots of special cards for Daddy. Daisy is upset when she realises it's Daddy's birthday and she hasn't got him a present.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Zac wants to join Pip and Posy's band, but he plays the drums too loudly and they send him away. Realising this was unkind, they make up with Zac.

programme.title: Milkshake! Storytime & Sign
programme.desc: Kiera-Nicole Brennan reads a children's book, accompanied by British Sign Language expert, visual storyteller and signer Aimee Campbell.

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: Hopper has a choice to make between an ordinary ice-cream cone or a huge one at the top of a mountain.

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Qamar counsels a journalist named Zahid who has PTSD after being imprisoned and tortured in Afghanistan. Dr Williams sends Royston for a scan to look for signs of prostate cancer, although the patient is adamant it should not be before an upcoming fishing trip he has arranged. Dr Mao turns medical detective when patient Andrew describes a combination of numbness in his jaw and face, and a cannabis smoker complains of chest pains and shakes.

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Australian soap opera charting the latest comings and goings of the residents of Summer Bay.

programme.title: Deadly Daughter (2020)
programme.desc: After a woman's father dies, his secret daughter sets a deadly trap for her because she feels cheated out of a life that was unfairly given to her sister. Thriller, starring Sarah Butler.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras catch up with young couple Beckii and Simon, whose new baby Reina was born 11 weeks early, and is spending the first part of her life in an incubator.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Road Rescue: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: A recycling plant needs two old portable cabins swapped out for new ones, making for some serious heavy lifting for Nick. Jim sees to an old Toyota abandoned in a live lane on the M1.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A patient passes out after Dr Chris Ferdinand administers a steroid injection into his knee, and Dr Aireen Razak meets a man struggling to shake a chest infection. Other patients include a man whose latest tattoo has become infected, and a woman who is suffering with chronic recurrent UTIs.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets an excitable English Bulldog that welcomes new guests by latching onto them with his vice-like grip, and owners Sarah and Andrew disagree on how best to tame him. Elsewhere, Graeme is called in to help owners Kerry and David deal with their pack of six Cocker Spaniels, and also meets a dog showing signs of aggression to strangers.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben spends a week in Dorset with former paratrooper Chris who, despite losing nearly everything, has spent the last five years walking the UK's coastline. Ben joins Chris and his faithful dog companion, Jet, 27,000 miles into their walk, and also meets Chris' partner and fellow hiker, Kate. Whilst in their company, Ben learns how to desalinate sea water, forage the nature around him and how to charm local fisherman for food.

programme.title: Who Killed Billie-Jo?
programme.desc: Examining the unsolved case of 13-year-old Billie-Jo Jenkins, who was murdered on the patio of her seaside home in 1997. This documentary reveals how and why Sion Jenkins, Billie-Jo's foster father, was initially convicted of the murder, only to be acquitted following a high-profile appeal and two major retrials at the Old Bailey.

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Damion has sustained numerous traumatic injuries after being trapped upside down in his car following a crash. Despite numerous injuries to the head and chest, Trauma Team Leader Dr Chris Pickering is most worried about Damion's lungs as his patient struggles to breathe.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Chris finds himself on the tail of a runaway Renault. The car is flying and when it hurtles round a blind bend, it rolls onto its roof.

programme.title: Oggy Oggy
programme.desc: Oggy Oggy exaggerates with SuperCat's SuperSignal, calling over and over for help without good reason.

programme.title: Odo
programme.desc: Shirley the Chicken is unbeatable at the game of Bird Statues - until she comes up against Odo.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy Fire Station is opened to the public and Norman is eager to try things out, crawling under safety tape and getting into the driving seat of a fire engine. However, his inquisitive nature and desire for excitement lead to danger when he climbs onto the roof to get closer to Tom and his helicopter.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends: All Engines Go!
programme.desc: A younger Thomas the Tank Engine goes on adventures with all of his friends as they work on the island of Sodor.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Charlene swims too close to the beach for the third time in a week, so Neville builds a shark-spotting drone - which quickly makes the lifeguards obsolete.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa's playgroup are making masks and there are carrot, robot and even pretty butterfly ones, the only thing missing is lots and lots of glitter.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig and Grandad Dog take Peppa, George and Danny bowling. Peppa, George and Grandpa Pig have never been before.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save an Out-of-Control Mini Patrol
programme.desc: Adventure following a squad of six heroic puppies and their tech-savvy 10-year-old leader as they protect the community of Adventure Bay.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: When spirited rabbit Pip tries to help sweet-natured mouse Posy, he cannot help showing off his roller skating skills - making Posy give up altogether. Pip has to find a way to get her back on her skates.

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington
programme.desc: Thanks to the Brown family, Paddington takes off and becomes the world's first bearonaut.

programme.title: Milo
programme.desc: Lofty, Milo and Lark work in a supermarket.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Moto Pups: Pups Save the Donuts
programme.desc: The Ruff-Ruff Pack steals Mr Porter's Mini-Donut Maker, so the Moto Pups set off to get the machine back in one piece.

programme.title: Daisy & Ollie
programme.sub-title: What Is the Perfect Birthday Present for My Daddy?
programme.desc: The postman arrives with lots of special cards for Daddy. Daisy is upset when she realises it's Daddy's birthday and she hasn't got him a present.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Zac wants to join Pip and Posy's band, but he plays the drums too loudly and they send him away. Realising this was unkind, they make up with Zac.

programme.title: Milkshake! Storytime & Sign
programme.desc: Kiera-Nicole Brennan reads a children's book, accompanied by British Sign Language expert, visual storyteller and signer Aimee Campbell.

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: Hopper has a choice to make between an ordinary ice-cream cone or a huge one at the top of a mountain.

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Qamar counsels a journalist named Zahid who has PTSD after being imprisoned and tortured in Afghanistan. Dr Williams sends Royston for a scan to look for signs of prostate cancer, although the patient is adamant it should not be before an upcoming fishing trip he has arranged. Dr Mao turns medical detective when patient Andrew describes a combination of numbness in his jaw and face, and a cannabis smoker complains of chest pains and shakes.

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Australian soap opera charting the latest comings and goings of the residents of Summer Bay.

programme.title: Deadly Daughter (2020)
programme.desc: After a woman's father dies, his secret daughter sets a deadly trap for her because she feels cheated out of a life that was unfairly given to her sister. Thriller, starring Sarah Butler.

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras catch up with young couple Beckii and Simon, whose new baby Reina was born 11 weeks early, and is spending the first part of her life in an incubator.

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Road Rescue: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: A recycling plant needs two old portable cabins swapped out for new ones, making for some serious heavy lifting for Nick. Jim sees to an old Toyota abandoned in a live lane on the M1.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A patient passes out after Dr Chris Ferdinand administers a steroid injection into his knee, and Dr Aireen Razak meets a man struggling to shake a chest infection. Other patients include a man whose latest tattoo has become infected, and a woman who is suffering with chronic recurrent UTIs.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets an excitable English Bulldog that welcomes new guests by latching onto them with his vice-like grip, and owners Sarah and Andrew disagree on how best to tame him. Elsewhere, Graeme is called in to help owners Kerry and David deal with their pack of six Cocker Spaniels, and also meets a dog showing signs of aggression to strangers.

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben spends a week in Dorset with former paratrooper Chris who, despite losing nearly everything, has spent the last five years walking the UK's coastline. Ben joins Chris and his faithful dog companion, Jet, 27,000 miles into their walk, and also meets Chris' partner and fellow hiker, Kate. Whilst in their company, Ben learns how to desalinate sea water, forage the nature around him and how to charm local fisherman for food.

programme.title: Who Killed Billie-Jo?
programme.desc: Examining the unsolved case of 13-year-old Billie-Jo Jenkins, who was murdered on the patio of her seaside home in 1997. This documentary reveals how and why Sion Jenkins, Billie-Jo's foster father, was initially convicted of the murder, only to be acquitted following a high-profile appeal and two major retrials at the Old Bailey.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: As the end of winter approaches, the residents look toward to the future. Bob trains Ruger to be a hunting dog, while Ray prepares for a life without his daughters.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The Kilchers face the threat of climate change, and after another winter of record temperatures, life on the homestead appears to be changing and everything is in flux.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto and Eivin attempt to turn the wilderness into a source of food. Atz Sr battles the elements and a menace at the head of the bay.

programme.title: Yukon Men
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in trapping season and few animals around, the men's race for their most prized commodity - fur - proves difficult.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Scorching desert heat pushes Rick to his limit. Alex risks facing snakes in his hunt for gold-rich pay dirt, and Greg crosses Australia to care for his unwell father.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn is injured and forced to rely on his crew to make the right calls while salvaging out on the Bering Sea, and toxic fumes threaten to end more than Zeke and Emily's season.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The Pomrenkes struggle on both land and sea to claim a new gold-rich mining ground. Meanwhile, Kris has one last chance to prove his captaincy and mining skills.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, a team struggles to pull apart a retired yacht. In Lewisham, south London, a tower block is demolished, while in Lancashire a tractor reveals treasure.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns spend all of their savings on a hydraulic digger that causes more problems than it solves. Elsewhere, the Blacklighters are dealt a dose of reality.

programme.desc: A serious storm strikes the fleet just weeks into the opilio crab season, and the captains celebrate their first pots.

programme.desc: After a long winter, cabin fever is setting in. Eivin and Atz get caught overnight in the back country, and Otto helps an orphan calf connect with its mother.

programme.desc: Shawn confronts his father for the family operation, to disastrous results. Emily brings her father aboard The Eroica, and Vernon recruits his daughter Elaine.

programme.desc: Josh and Garon must navigate some dangerous situations as they haul huge equipment up a muddy road. Rick tries to sell a load of batteries for his dad..

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, novelist and presenter David Baddiel, comedian, actress and writer Cariad Lloyd and stand-up comedian and actor Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate questions and facts on the theme of nature and nurture. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult to crack that points are instead awarded for the answers deemed most interesting.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Jon and Lucy are asked to make a UK travel show with Sally Lindsay - they jump in an RV, visit Whitby, and sample the food and legends of the area in the hope of winning a BAFTA.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Joining Sara Pascoe are Ahir Shah with his lecture 'You Don't Have To Be An Expert To Solve Big Problems', Harriet Kemsley and Bobby Mair, and Jo Brand saying 'Older People Are Happier'..

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: The celebrations for Naomi's birthday get out of hand when another girl flirts with Josh.

programme.title: Famalam
programme.desc: The competitive aunties battle it out at a wedding and there is a preview of the latest Nollywood reality show. Plus, catch up with the ever-thwarted Nigerian philanthropist Prince Alyus and discover what happens when someone expressed their real feelings about Beyonce. Return of the comedy sketch show, starring Vivienne Acheampong and Samson Kayo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom Ford sets his heart on a Ford Fiesta Mk1 from Spain and convinces the others to splash the cash - but there's a surprise in store then the Lazy Boys see the car in person.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom 'Wookie' Ford thinks sourcing a cool retro van that someone can use to sell coffee in is a no-brainer, and the boys find a Renault 4F6 - but can they make a profit at auction?.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Western Australia conduct a two-day drug-dealing operation that exposes one suspect's ownership of a large number of dogs in poor condition..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian officers track wanted offenders and bail jumpers, hear a young motorist's fanciful tale, and put out spot fires on the Hume Highway..

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Oz's top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Thailand where he meets one of his heroes, David Thompson, who has devoted himself to understanding Thai cuisine. He also takes a train to Phuket to learn the art of hot and sour tom yum goong, and visits Melaka to explore the Nyonya-style cooking.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police stop a speeding motorcyclist, are called to a car accident, and identify a man using stolen credit cards in Western Australia..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: The second heat of Oz's take on the hit format features the Battle of the Tradies, the only husband-and-wife team, Queenslander larrikin mates and a former elite gymnast.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Time-conscious traveller Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Paul Rudd for a brisk romp round the Finnish capital. To get their bearings the pair head straight to the ladies toilet in the Torni hotel, which offers the best view of the city. They then go kayaking and snack on some reindeer jerky at the city's Hakaniemi market. Richard and Paul also visit not one, but two saunas - one of which can be found in a well-known burger chain. The duo also visit the wilderness island of Seurasaari, go foraging, and finish up in a sweet shop.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks for a group of comedians, with help from Alex Horne. In this edition, Jon Richardson strives to create the perfect music video.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites stand-up comedian Phil Wang, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian and comedy writer Holly Walsh to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include soap opera The Archers, having a bath and making friends with an aerobics instructor.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Joe Lycett, Joe Swash and Ruth Madeley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for this festive edition of the comedy game show. Did one of the panellists really program a satnav so their mother's trip to Lakeside ended up in the Lake District? And would one of the captains really hold up a train to get his daughter's cuddly toy back? Or were they just festive fibs? Rob Brydon hosts the fun.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The return for the QI regular's no-limits comedy show - Alan's guests in this edition of the programme are Sue Perkins, Jamali Maddix, Lara Ricote and Josh Jones.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ed Gamble and Lou Sanders have been friends for years, so much so that she's bought a 'his 'n' hers' set of driving gloves to tackle 1000 kilometres of Iceland.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.
