programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites stand-up comedian Phil Wang, actor Stephen Mangan and comedian and comedy writer Holly Walsh to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include soap opera The Archers, having a bath and making friends with an aerobics instructor.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Joe Lycett, Joe Swash and Ruth Madeley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for this festive edition of the comedy game show. Did one of the panellists really program a satnav so their mother's trip to Lakeside ended up in the Lake District? And would one of the captains really hold up a train to get his daughter's cuddly toy back? Or were they just festive fibs? Rob Brydon hosts the fun.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The return for the QI regular's no-limits comedy show - Alan's guests in this edition of the programme are Sue Perkins, Jamali Maddix, Lara Ricote and Josh Jones.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ed Gamble and Lou Sanders have been friends for years, so much so that she's bought a 'his 'n' hers' set of driving gloves to tackle 1000 kilometres of Iceland.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies returns with the comedy game show. Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson, Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson accept a potato-throwing challenge.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, novelist and presenter David Baddiel, comedian, actress and writer Cariad Lloyd and stand-up comedian and actor Ross Noble join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate questions and facts on the theme of nature and nurture. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult to crack that points are instead awarded for the answers deemed most interesting.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Jon and Lucy are asked to make a UK travel show with Sally Lindsay - they jump in an RV, visit Whitby, and sample the food and legends of the area in the hope of winning a BAFTA.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Joining Sara Pascoe are Ahir Shah with his lecture 'You Don't Have To Be An Expert To Solve Big Problems', Harriet Kemsley and Bobby Mair, and Jo Brand saying 'Older People Are Happier'..

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: The celebrations for Naomi's birthday get out of hand when another girl flirts with Josh.

programme.title: Famalam
programme.desc: The competitive aunties battle it out at a wedding and there is a preview of the latest Nollywood reality show. Plus, catch up with the ever-thwarted Nigerian philanthropist Prince Alyus and discover what happens when someone expressed their real feelings about Beyonce. Return of the comedy sketch show, starring Vivienne Acheampong and Samson Kayo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom Ford sets his heart on a Ford Fiesta Mk1 from Spain and convinces the others to splash the cash - but there's a surprise in store then the Lazy Boys see the car in person.

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: Tom 'Wookie' Ford thinks sourcing a cool retro van that someone can use to sell coffee in is a no-brainer, and the boys find a Renault 4F6 - but can they make a profit at auction?.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Western Australia conduct a two-day drug-dealing operation that exposes one suspect's ownership of a large number of dogs in poor condition..

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian officers track wanted offenders and bail jumpers, hear a young motorist's fanciful tale, and put out spot fires on the Hume Highway..

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Oz's top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Thailand where he meets one of his heroes, David Thompson, who has devoted himself to understanding Thai cuisine. He also takes a train to Phuket to learn the art of hot and sour tom yum goong, and visits Melaka to explore the Nyonya-style cooking.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police stop a speeding motorcyclist, are called to a car accident, and identify a man using stolen credit cards in Western Australia..

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: The second heat of Oz's take on the hit format features the Battle of the Tradies, the only husband-and-wife team, Queenslander larrikin mates and a former elite gymnast.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Time-conscious traveller Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Paul Rudd for a brisk romp round the Finnish capital. To get their bearings the pair head straight to the ladies toilet in the Torni hotel, which offers the best view of the city. They then go kayaking and snack on some reindeer jerky at the city's Hakaniemi market. Richard and Paul also visit not one, but two saunas - one of which can be found in a well-known burger chain. The duo also visit the wilderness island of Seurasaari, go foraging, and finish up in a sweet shop.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The return for the QI regular's no-limits comedy show - Alan's guests in this edition of the programme are Sue Perkins, Jamali Maddix, Lara Ricote and Josh Jones.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Seen comes under suspicion following Kris's dramatic escape, while a seance spells trouble on G-wing when excitable Tina O'Kane tries to communicate with the spirit of her old friend Al - leading to violence. It is also the day of Di and Jim's wedding - but the chances of it going off without a hitch are slim, especially when a couple of uninvited guests turn up to throw a spanner in the works. Prison drama, starring Jack Ellis, Charlotte Lucas, Jennifer Ness and Tracey Wilkinson.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Dominic tries to give Isaac's father the best treatment possible, Lofty is desperate to repair their relationship, while Ange turns to Carole in order to protect her son. When an old patient of Jac's shows up with a tempting offer, she has to decide how far she will go for personal gain.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Part one of two. Crabbe leaves the restaurant behind for a day at the races, but his fun is cut short by the discovery of a stable lad's dead body. Starring Richard Griffiths, Samantha Womack, Maggie Steed and Malcolm Sinclair.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: What should have been the happiest moment of Debbie McAllister's life turns into a hideous nightmare when Chandler lets his mask slip, raping her on their wedding night. However, his time is rapidly running out as the Criminal Investigations Bureau start probing his career, and in desperation he acquires a firearm under false pretences and absconds with his pregnant wife - can Meadows and Webb track them down before events reach a tragic conclusion?.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Dominic continues to treat Isaac's father, Lofty is determined to protect him, but when Dominic refuses to let him it puts their marriage in doubt and plays into Isaac's hands. A hungover Jac is mortified she can't remember how the previous night ended with Ken, much to Kian's amusement. She eventually gets her answer, but not before having to save Ken's life first.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: With Dylan nowhere to be found, Connie and Elle are forced to work together to pitch for funding for a new trauma centre. With both women struggling to hide their resentment of each other, their relationship hits rock bottom. Elsewhere, Bea grows concerned for Alicia, while Gem and Rash are tasked with looking after Connie's goldfish.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler finally runs out of options and as a gunshot echoes around the station, Debbie is rushed into hospital in a desperate bid to save her unborn child. The Sun Hill ladies take new arrival Gemma Osbourne for a night on the town to put the tragic events of her first day behind her and discover she already knows her way round the West End, while Gilmore presses Aston to face up to his sexuality - but gets a surprising reaction.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy warns Trevor to stay clear of the Mitchells.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy jumps to all the wrong conclusions. Jamie asks Sonia to marry him.

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: The World Powerboat Championship begins, and things are looking bad for Leo as Ken Masters plots a whitewash.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A Cardale schoolgirl begins behaving erratically, causing concern for her parents and provoking a professional difference of opinion between Will and Beth. While they're squabbling over the cause of her symptoms, Practice Manager Kim attends a school reunion where she meets a former teacher whose health problems give her a fresh insight into the case. Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star.

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth and Richard take over a country cottage for a couple of days, with unexpected results. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour departs for a new teaching job, leaving Clegg and Compo at a loose end now he is no longer around to drag them into his eccentric schemes. However, they do not realise an old friend is about to return to the village. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A brewery heiress appears to be the sole witness to the murder of a serial killer - but she was herself presumed dead 19 years previously. Dalziel assumes she is an imposter, until further research uncovers bad blood between the brothers currently running the family business. Detective drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The inclusion of a letter in a late actor's biography reopens an old case for the team - but reliving the past threatens to be too much for the widow who was accidentally responsible for his death. DAC Strickland's cocky nephew lends his assistance, but his affections for Sandra bring out the worst in Gerry and Brian. Dexter Fletcher guest stars.

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Allie becomes increasingly worried about the number of customers she is losing to rival salon Blade Runner, and begins to suspect a traitor has given Mia an unfair advantage. Finn tries to charm her by ensuring she lands an important contract, and even offers to get a divorce if she'll agree to a relationship with him - a suggestion she throws back in his face. Sarah Parish and Amanda Holden star.

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Drama set in a Manchester hairdressing salon. Husband-and-wife owners Allie and Gavin celebrate the 10th anniversary of their business, but when empty premises across the road are purchased by a mysterious beauty, Allie is forced to confront emotions she has kept hidden for 18 years. Amanda Holden and Sarah Parish star.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The final two weddings take place, with 41-year-old single mum Melissa being partnered with Disney-loving dad-of-two Josh, and Melinda matched with fellow business mogul Layton.

programme.title: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins USA
programme.desc: Maximum pressure is applied to the celebrities, who face a sky-scraping tactical challenge and an unrelenting simulation.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, focusing their attentions on Sitting on a Fortune, Close to Me, You, Nadiya's Fast Flavours, Animal, UFO Witness, This Morning's Spin to Win feature and the ITV News. Narrated by Craig Cash.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonard's secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is surprised when he bumps into his first love, Dana. Meanwhile, Erica and Barry find out they have nowhere to live on their college campus.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray and Geoff have to run around Jenkintown looking for an important cheese steak after a food delivery job does not go to plan.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy's Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are often too distracted by their lively bar to look after their business. The national landmark, which has played host to an array of famous names including Mark Twain, President Ulysses S Grant and JP Morgan, has no dedicated accommodation manager, so guests sometimes struggle to receive the attention they need and end up feeling the hotel has become an afterthought beside the noisy saloon.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Connecticut's oldest inn, the Curtis House in Woodbury, which has been owned by the Hardisty family for generations. However, the business has started to fall apart and their legacy is on the brink of being lost. Siblings Chris and TJ, who are in charge, no longer speak to each other and the staff and guests feel stuck in the middle.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The final two weddings take place, with 41-year-old single mum Melissa being partnered with Disney-loving dad-of-two Josh, and Melinda matched with fellow business mogul Layton.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together, while Leonard, Howard and Raj must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket. Plus, Sheldon's Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to share his love of dancing with unenthusiastic son Luke and Claire struggles to hide her frustration while teaching an overly cautious Alex to drive. Mitch and Cam enter the cut-throat world of wedding venue booking.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria settles a score with another mum during a school visit, Mitch sets out to prove he is more environmentally aware than his neighbour, Manny and Luke have a double date with twins, and Alex goes to see a therapist. Jesse Eisenberg and Jane Krakowski guest star.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For his first task back in the field, Jeffords prepares to join Peralta and Boyle on a mission to infiltrate a gym where steroids are being sold illegally, but Peralta begins to have second thoughts about whether the sergeant is ready. Meanwhile, Santiago and Diaz try to determine who has burgled Gin's flat.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: While investigating a string of hotel robberies together, Peralta is upset to discover Santiago is considering leaving the precinct to work with his rival, the Vulture, in the special crimes unit. Holt and Jeffords try to think up some strategies to make the team more efficient. Featuring a guest appearance by Adam Sandler.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: On a weekend cabin trip with Penny and Amy, Sheldon spills one of Leonard's secrets, while Howard and Bernadette must draw a line when Raj goes overboard with pregnancy gifts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pair's squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. She, meanwhile, accuses Cameron of being a snob when he refuses her daughter's hand-me-downs, and Jay enters Stella into a dog show.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stella's belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that she's pregnant.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt is taken by surprise when his long-time nemesis, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch (guest star Kyra Sedgwick), arrives to carry out an inspection of his precinct. Peralta and Jeffords test the boundaries between 'work friendship' and 'real friendship' while they investigate a stabbing at a trendy milk bar. Boyle searches for a guest to take to his ex-wife's engagement party - will Diaz come to the rescue?.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad has time to kill when the arrival of the Serbian president's motorcade to Brooklyn is delayed, so Peralta launches the seventh annual Jimmy Jab Games, an eccentric series of races and contests held in the precinct building. Meanwhile, Jeffords and Holt must set up a new drug task force approved by Holt's nemesis, Madeline Wuntch.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to share his love of dancing with unenthusiastic son Luke and Claire struggles to hide her frustration while teaching an overly cautious Alex to drive. Mitch and Cam enter the cut-throat world of wedding venue booking.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon disagree over whether to continue holding their regular Roommate Agreement meetings, with Leonard suggesting they are no longer required, while Sheldon believes they are still essential. As the pair's squabble quickly escalates into a full-blown argument, the rest of their friends turn up for a planned Game of Thrones viewing party, and end up taking sides in the dispute - resulting in two warring factions taking up residence in 4A and 4B. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. She, meanwhile, accuses Cameron of being a snob when he refuses her daughter's hand-me-downs, and Jay enters Stella into a dog show.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam worry about the growing cost of their wedding, so they agree to each sell a prized possession to earn some extra cash. Jay, Gloria and Manny challenge one another to step outside their comfort zones, involving traditional sausages, pickle and Stella's belly, while the Dunphy kids are in a mischievous mood after finding an old answering machine recording of Claire breaking the news that she's pregnant.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Holt is taken by surprise when his long-time nemesis, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch (guest star Kyra Sedgwick), arrives to carry out an inspection of his precinct. Boyle searches for a guest to take to his ex-wife's engagement party - will Diaz come to the rescue?.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: Thrill-seeking contestants compete on the world's largest obstacle course, which includes Donut Run, Crazy Beams, Pole Vault, the Toothbrush Sweeper and Launch Pads among its extreme challenges.

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane takes a look at clips that have seen the people who star in them become online celebrities in their own right, including a video featuring an attention-grabbing impression of Arnold Schwarzenegger. Plus, the story of a software developer-turned-fugitive, and a singer-songwriter who found fame thanks to his posts on a social networking site.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: The Big Monthly Round Up
programme.desc: Entertainment guru Lucy Jones rounds up the biggest music, telly and pop culture gossip of the month. With a massive pop playlist to match.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: Eddie is non-committal about going to college, so Louis organises a trip to UCLA after learning that Eddie's cousin is enrolled there. Evan and Emery prepare for a post-Y2K world.

programme.title: Fresh Off the Boat
programme.desc: During Marvin's retirement party, Grandma Huang announces that she too is 'retiring'. Evan and the boys worry this means the end of dentist-patient confidentiality.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The trio try to stop a warlock who has abducted their muse, with the intention of exploiting her creative inspiration for evil. Meanwhile, Cole becomes concerned that without his demonic powers he can no longer protect the love of his life. Supernatural drama, starring Alyssa Milano, Holly Marie Combs and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Leo tries to ease Paige's sense of guilt by taking her back to relive events up to the car accident in which her step-parents died, while Phoebe and Cole are possessed by outlaw ghosts from the 1950s. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben takes Emma to his old doctor for a check-up and admits he hasn't had a medical for years. When the physician insists Ben has an examination and finds something of concern, Ben has a panic attack about his future and worries about who will take care of Emma if he's no longer around. Bonnie has lunch with Brad, having mistaken him for his twin brother Tad. Comedy, with Jean-Luc Bilodeau.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Riley realises that she hasn't met any of Ross's friends and decides to throw a cocktail party so she can get acquainted with them. Danny is worried that he knows nothing about his new girlfriend Ashley and goes to great lengths to find out her last name. Bonnie has some serious explaining to do when a valuable item goes missing. Eddie Cibrian guest stars.

programme.title: Wife Swap USA
programme.desc: A picture-perfect woman whose husband is obsessed with cleaning swaps homes, families and lives with a party-goer whose three-year-old son stays up all night.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Gold-medal gymnast Gabby Douglas pretends to be an office worker who wants to open her own gym - but her real task is to surprise up-and-coming gymnasts and inspiring coaches.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Tony-winning Broadway star Idina Menzel goes undercover to meet unknown musical talents who aspire to make it to the big stage. Disguised as a receptionist from a small town who dreams of performing on stage in the future, Idina meets two brilliant young singers and one unique and inspiring performer. In the end, Idina reveals her true identity and helps to turn their dreams into reality.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay gives his advice to Paul Bazzini, an award-winning chef from New York who now owns a restaurant in Ridgewood, New Jersey. Paul confesses he has lost his passion for food and is struggling to keep up with the business, a situation that seems evident to other members of staff, his wife and customers.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Mojito, a Cuban cafe in Brooklyn, New York. The restaurant was the shared dream of two newlyweds who have separated since its opening, and whose constant public quarrelling is distracting staff and driving customers away.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben, Riley, Danny and Tucker wonder where their own lives are heading when Bonnie delegates a very important job to them. Riley feels conflicted about her relationships with Ben and Danny, and Bonnie makes a decision that leaves everyone feeling frustrated.

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie promotes Riley to chief bridesmaid and demands a crazy hen party, while Brad asks Danny to be his best man and throw an epic stag do. Tucker tells everyone he's going to a television convention in Detroit, but he's actually making his annual trek to Las Vegas, where he spends one weekend a year living his dream of being a lounge singer. Dan Castellaneta guest stars.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm tries to stop his little brother going to a school for the gifted, but the devious plan backfires in spectacular fashion - leaving Dewey labelled emotionally disturbed. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Erik Per Sullivan.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Lois resolves to go to Canada to meet her father's second wife, but soon regrets her decision. Meanwhile, Hal foolishly demands Dewey run in a father-son race with him, despite being temporarily blind. Comedy, starring Bryan Cranston and jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Following the break-up of Penny's relationship, Leonard finally summons up the courage to ask her out. When she accepts, they both turn to Sheldon for advice on how to handle the forthcoming date. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.

programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Russell Howard uses ear wax to charm a nice lady called Carol, Asim Chaudhry goes digging for invertebrates and Liza Tarbuck makes a puzzle for children.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Extended version of the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Tiger King 2, An Audience with Adele, Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Close to Me, Inside Beverly Hills: The Land of the Rich and Famous, BBC/ITV News (Austria) and Newsnight (The PM).

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Thunder Road (2018)
programme.desc: A US police officer finds his life falling apart after the death of his mother. During a messy divorce, he attempts to find solace in building a stronger relationship with his young daughter, but events are already spiralling beyond his control. Comedy drama, starring Jim Cummings, Nican Robinson, Jocelyn DeBoer and Kendal Farr.

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan.

programme.title: Santa Fe Passage (1955)
programme.desc: A wagon scout accused of collusion with Apaches is given a chance to redeem himself when he is hired to transport a shipment of arms to Santa Fe. The owner of the valuable freight happens to be a mixed-race woman and at first he shows her only disrespect, but has to overcome his prejudice when he finds himself falling for her. Western adventure, with John Payne, Faith Domergue and Slim Pickens.

programme.title: Apache Uprising (1965)
programme.desc: Western, starring Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy with a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack. Also starring Corinne Calvet, Lon Chaney Jr and John Russell.

credits.actor: Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy
a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak.

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009)
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston.

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz.

programme.title: Call Me by Your Name (2017)
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Elio spends his lazy summers at his family's Italian villa, where his academic father welcomes research assistant Oliver to help with his work on Greco-Roman culture. Before long Elio and Oliver grow close, leading to a summer that will alter both of their lives for ever. Director Luca Guadagnino's Oscar and Bafta-winning romantic drama, based on the novel by André Aciman, starring Armie Hammer, Timothee Chalamet and Michael Stuhlbarg.

credits.director: based on the novel by André Aciman

programme.title: Elizabeth (1998)
programme.desc: Elizabeth I rises to the throne of a divided and troubled Britain, and the early years of her reign find her under pressure to marry and produce an heir - while enemies both overseas and within her own court plot to bring about her downfall. Shekhar Kapur's historical drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston and Joseph Fiennes.

programme.title: Thunder Road (2018)
programme.desc: A US police officer finds his life falling apart after the death of his mother. During a messy divorce, he attempts to find solace in building a stronger relationship with his young daughter, but events are already spiralling beyond his control. Comedy drama, starring Jim Cummings, Nican Robinson, Jocelyn DeBoer and Kendal Farr.

Director Luca Guadagnino's Oscar and Bafta-winning romantic drama, based on the novel by André Aciman, starring Armie Hammer, Timothee Chalamet and Michael Stuhlbarg.

credits.director: based on the novel by André Aciman

programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Gennaro Contaldo heads to the island of Sicily, getting a masterclass in local sweets that inspire a chocolate cannoli. programme.title: Jamie Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in Tuscany, where he meets 88-year-old cookbook queen Nonna Miriam, who teaches him her all-time favourite beef stew with homemade pappardelle pasta. programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea hosts a dinner to celebrate a significant place in Charleston's Gullah history. West African peanut stew and stuffed whole snapper are on the menu.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea celebrates citrus fruits with a deliciously tangy menu. She makes tequila tangerine chicken, citrus salad and a limoncello trifle.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Lamb Tagine and Chicken Caesar Salad
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, revealing how to prepare lamb tagine, pan-fried aubergine and cumin crunch as well as crispy polenta chicken Caesar salad, each within the space of 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shows how to prepare sausage cassoulet, warm broccoli salad, and berry and custard pie in 30 minutes.

programme.title: Chronicles Of Nadiya
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain visits her family village in Bangladesh. Using local produce and techniques she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with mango..

programme.title: Follow Donal to Europe
programme.desc: In Lisbon, Donal helps make a legendary custard tart in a famous bakery. Then, fish is on the menu, with salt cod and gazpacho and sardines on toast.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads to Boston, where he goes on shopping spree in the public market ahead of cooking with local ingredients. He visits a restaurant where cocktails are often inhaled rather than drunk and finishes by taking a trip to Fenway Park baseball stadium to live out a boyhood dream.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Lamb Tagine and Chicken Caesar Salad
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food, revealing how to prepare lamb tagine, pan-fried aubergine and cumin crunch as well as crispy polenta chicken Caesar salad, each within the space of 15 minutes.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shows how to prepare sausage cassoulet, warm broccoli salad, and berry and custard pie in 30 minutes.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea hosts a dinner to celebrate a significant place in Charleston's Gullah history. West African peanut stew and stuffed whole snapper are on the menu.

programme.title: Delicious Miss Brown
programme.desc: Kardea celebrates citrus fruits with a deliciously tangy menu. She makes tequila tangerine chicken, citrus salad and a limoncello trifle.

programme.title: Be My Guest with Ina Garten
programme.desc: Ina Garten's friends Rob Marshall and John DeLuca sip watermelon cosmopolitans. Plus, John makes salmon burgers with his mum's simplest slaw.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond has collected her best one-pan recipes. She makes no-fuss lemon basil shrimp risotto, loaded veggie pasta, chicken fennel bake and crispy grilled cheese.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by Alison Hammond and Aldo Zilli in the first episode of a new cookery series, which focuses on dishes that conjure up memories of holidays. Ainsley prepares spicy Seafood linguine with chilli and cherry tomatoes, Alison makes a Tunisian inspired lamb and cous cous dish, and Aldo gives a masterclass in making crispy chilli and parsley calamari. Finally, Ainsley also whips up a souvlaki and tiramisu.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins set the remaining contestants three tasks involving pastry, beginning by asking them to make signature savoury parcels. For the technical challenge, they must prepare a cake that hails from the Brittany region of France - the kouign amann, which none of the bakers has ever heard of - before creating two different types of eclair in the showstopper round. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood judge the hopefuls' efforts before deciding who is star baker and who is going home.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef explores Salem, Massachusetts, which was made famous by the witch trials of 1692. He visits a unique spice shop, where he picks up some ingredients to cook with, and also meets a seafood artist and makes a stop at Turner's, a family-run seafood business.

programme.title: Chronicles Of Nadiya
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain visits her family village in Bangladesh. Using local produce and techniques she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with mango..

programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson focuses on Italian food, preparing pasta with mussels, and black rice with squid rings.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert travels to Mr B's Southern Kitchen in Florida, where he finds a failing restaurant that is tearing siblings Ninkia and Calvin apart.

programme.desc: A gigantic meteor enters Earth's orbit and begins to disintegrate, raining space debris across the globe. Los Angeles is destined to be destroyed within three days, leaving one man in a race against time to find his wife and son before it is too late. Sci-fi thriller, starring Joe Lando, Claudia Christian, Cooper Harris, Brendan Bradley, Sueann Han and Gregory Paul Smith.

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Solar Attack (2006)
programme.desc: The US president needs all the help he can get when a solar storm lights up the sky and threatens to wipe out all life on Earth. Sci-fi adventure, starring Louis Gossett Jr, Mark Dacascos and Bill Lake.

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Guardians of the Tomb (2018)
programme.desc: A team of scientists lose a colleague in an ancient labyrinth, and must battle their way through a swarm of man-eating spiders to discover the secret behind the arachnids' power. Sci-fi adventure, starring Li Bingbing, Kellan Lutz and Kelsey Grammer.

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: En route to the Federation archives at Memory Alpha, the Enterprise encounters a strange energy field which takes over the mind of a lieutenant aboard the ship. Starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: First of a two-part story. Picard and Data are assigned to investigate why Spock has undertaken an unauthorised mission. Sci-fi adventure, guest starring Leonard Nimoy.

programme.title: Airwolf
programme.desc: Caitlin's school reunion is thrown into chaos by kidnappers who try to snatch wealthy former classmate Barbara Scarelli _ and it's up to Hawke and Dominic to save the day. Jean Bruce Scott, Jan-Michael Vincent and Ernest Borgnine star.

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A Marine Corps officer vows to avenge his sister's murder, and Walker must find him before another life is lost. Adventure, starring Chuck Norris.

programme.title: The Thing (1982)
programme.desc: A mysterious shape-shifting alien kills and impersonates its victims on an Antarctic research base manned by a crew of American scientists. The researchers face the ordeal of stopping the creature from making its way to civilisation - but are in danger of jeopardising the task as mounting paranoia turns them against each other. John Carpenter's sci-fi horror remake, starring Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, TK Carter, Keith David and Richard Dysart.

programme.title: The Asphyx (1972)
programme.desc: Supernatural chiller following the experiments of 19th-century scientist Robert Stephens, whose dabblings in the unknown uncover the secret of immortality. Robert Powell, Jane Lapotaire and Alex Scott also star.

programme.title: Live: Petrie Hosken
programme.desc: Petrie goes over the days big stories and gives us her take on things bringing the very best and latest news stories overnight..

programme.title: Vanessa Feltz
programme.desc: Vanessa guides you through the big stories of the day from the world of politics, current affairs and showbiz. Big names, exclusive interviews, and your thoughts on what's got the nation talking.

programme.title: The Julia Hartley-Brewer Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The Queen of Breakfast covers all the stories you need to know to start your day. Political heavyweights, no-nonsense interviews, and the only safe space for fierce opinions.

programme.title: The Independent Republic of Mike Graham
programme.desc: The host tears his way through the morning newspapers, and brings a much-needed dose of common sense to the day's big stories.

programme.title: Ian Collins
programme.desc: Charm, wit and sophistication personified, Ian Collins, cuts through the echo-chamber with hard-hitting monologues, stimulating debates and dedicated time for your calls..

programme.title: Vanessa Feltz
programme.desc: Vanessa guides you through the big stories of the day from the world of politics, current affairs and showbiz. Big names, exclusive interviews, and your thoughts on what's got the nation talking.

programme.title: Piers Morgan Uncensored
programme.desc: The host presents his unmissable verdict on the day's global events with an hour of fearless debate, straight-talking interviews with the world's leading figures, and plenty of fun.

programme.title: First Edition
programme.desc: TalkTV's flagship evening news programme takes an energetic look at tomorrow's news, tonight, through the lens of the newspaper first editions..

programme.title: Piers Morgan Uncensored
programme.desc: The host presents his unmissable verdict on the day's global events with an hour of fearless debate, straight-talking interviews with the world's leading figures, and plenty of fun.

programme.title: Horror Hospital (1973)
programme.desc: An aspiring rock star is persuaded to take a relaxing break at a health farm, but gets a rude awakening on discovering his fellow guests all have identical scars on their foreheads. Horror, starring Michael Gough, Robin Askwith, Dennis Price and Vanessa Shaw.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Alien devices land on the lunar surface and emit oxygen, turning the moon into an atmosphere-rich world with blue skies and a warm sun. Unfortunately, the idyllic conditions prove short-lived. Starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain.

programme.title: The Way Ahead (1944)
programme.desc: Slipshod British Army recruits face a testing time as they undergo a tough training regimen aimed at whipping them into shape to fight in the Second World War. Drama, starring David Niven, Stanley Holloway, Raymond Huntley, William Hartnell, John Laurie and James Donald.

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes..

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Strange hieroglyphics appear on all of Alpha's screens, alerting the crew to a bizarre new menace - a huge alien space brain intent on communicating with them. Starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain.

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: How castles changed from being siege-proof fortresses to places of ceremony and fantasy, with reference to the rebuilt Windsor Castle as a notable example.

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen arrive in Birmingham on the latest leg of their culinary journey. They take in the sights and sounds of the Bull Ring market, where they feast on the finest dim sum, take a canal trip through the heart of the city - leading to an impromptu ballet lesson for Mason - and head to the famous Balti Triangle, where they help to create a special Irish curry.

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands.

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Panama
programme.desc: The animals of the cloud forest and the mountain rainforests. Witness the birth of peccaries and listen in on the howler monkeys.

programme.title: Where the River Runs Black (1986)
programme.desc: A priest ventures deep into the Amazon to set up a mission, and has a son with a mysterious woman. When both are killed, the boy ventures out of the jungle and travels to a city, where he is taken in by his father's kindly mentor - but the youth struggles to adapt to modern living. Drama, starring Alessandro Rabelo and Charles Durning.

programme.title: Tomorrow is Forever (1946)
programme.desc: A man returns from the First World War horribly scarred, and allows his wife and child to believe he has been killed in action rather than revealing his disfigurement. Drama, starring Claudette Colbert, Orson Welles, George Brent, Lucile Watson, Richard Long and Natalie Wood.

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering learns that the manager of his Paris shop is shipping illegal narcotics in the base of antiques he ships abroad.

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Magic Moments: The Spell of Nature
programme.desc: Magical footage of the natural world from across the globe and around the year.

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six uncovers a plot in which interim Number Two has asked the rebellious old watchmaker to design a time bomb inside a retirement trophy for his predecessor.

programme.title: The Long Firm
programme.desc: Fading film star Ruby Ryder agrees to help Harry turn his beloved Stardust Club into an erotic revue by choreographing his strippers and liaising with DS Mooney in overseeing the Soho porn racket. As Mooney takes a shine to Ruby, things are good for a while until Starks' toy boy Tommy becomes infatuated with her. When she finds it difficult to resist his youthful charms, the pair are taught a harsh lesson. Lena Headey and Joe Absolom guest star, with Mark Strong and George Costigan.

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: It may be late but you can rely on Magic to keep you company all night long with nothing but our greatest hits.

programme.title: Brighten Up Your Breakfast!
programme.desc: Let us brighten up your morning with some of our favourite feel-good songs!.

programme.title: Top 10 at 10: 2002
programme.desc: It's throwback time! We're bringing you 10 of the biggest pop hits from our 2002 archive.

programme.title: Magic Picks Of The Week
programme.desc: Join Eloise Carr for throwbacks, personal faves and legends in the Magic Picks of the Week.

programme.title: Can't Get Enough of Pop
programme.desc: With its catchy choruses and dancing beats, we can't get enough of pop music, and neither will you after listening to these pop-tastic hits...

programme.title: Chesney Hawkes' 90s Number 1s
programme.desc: Join The One and Only Chesney Hawkes as he walks you through some of his favourite chart-topping hits from the 90s! Featuring Sinead O Connor, Bryan Adams, Hanson and more....

programme.title: American Idols! Through The Years
programme.desc: Wish you were an American Idol live vicariously through Magic, catch American Idols! Through The Years.

programme.title: Top 10 at 10: 1995
programme.desc: It's throwback time! We're bringing you 10 of the biggest pop hits from our 1995 archive.

programme.title: This Week's Magic Singles
programme.desc: These are the new songs we're loving right now. Check out this mix of today's feel-good favourites and a huge dollop of laidback loveliness straight from the Magic HQ.

programme.title: Mellow Magic!
programme.desc: Full to the brim with all your favourite feelgood and relaxing songs of all time - it can only be the dreamy Mellow Magic.

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan travels around the UK on the hunt for incredible tales. He starts his journey in Whitby, where he discovers what inspired the creation of Dracula. He also journeys up the coast to learn about the Hobs - mythical cave-dwelling creatures with healing powers - before heading inland to Knaresborough to visit Mother Shipton's Cave.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Roisin Conaty compete against Jon Richardson and Nish Kumar. Adam Buxton joins the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Spain to investigate how much orange is in orange squash. In snowy Canada, Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive, while Kate Quilton reveals the surprising reason why so many of the UK's favourite biscuits have little holes all over them.

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Jenny Eclair are challenged to make Kimono-style garments against the clock.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: London couple Merwyn and Liesl Lobo are looking for a holiday home in Orihuela Costa in eastern Spain, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their £125,000 budget.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: B&B owners in France juggle a busy diary with the pressures of parenthood. In Spain, a microbrewery ramps up promotion, and a couple in France create face cream from snail slime.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire, to meet Tom who is obsessed with motocross. Henry upcycles two Porsche wheel rims into a cool pair of stools.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Sussex to meet Bill and Annie, who have a penchant for Star Wars collectables and most importantly, as far as Henry is concerned, motorbikes.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: There is a twist in the tale as the detectives search for relatives of a south London woman, while another case uncovers the story of a man who led a double life.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the White Swan in Deighton, North Yorkshire, where Roman Solnar and Tamsyn Muller hope their guests will appreciate their no-nonsense approach.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Clough View Farm in Matlock, Derbyshire, where hosts Lisa Hardy and Sally Dakin hope that their generosity of spirit will be a hit with their guests. Nick and David count the costs and serve up some suspicions at dinner. A long wait for breakfast leaves the guests grumbling, and Tamsyn and Roman find their feedback hard to stomach.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Buxted Inn in Uckfield, East Sussex, run by Nick Bolton and chef David Kirby, and where the focus is on food and wine. Lisa is charmed by the character of the place, but Farid and John think it has a corporate feel. At breakfast, a menu misunderstanding leaves Farid with more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Crescent Victoria hotel in Margate, Kent, where hosts Farid Al-Faisal and John Dennis aim to treat their guests like royalty. Unfortunately, only one of the pairs feel like princesses, with the rest being less than impressed by the attempt at luxury.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The White Swan is first and Roman and Tamsyn have some cracks to paper over from previous critiques in the week.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide prospective buyers in Yorkshire through the complex world of viewings and agents as they try to buy a home. Kirstie meets Leeds locals Mia and Jack, who are ready to move out of Mia's family home. Elsewhere, Phil is tasked to find a four bedroom family home for childhood sweethearts Rachel and Chris.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Carly and Phil in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, who are unsure whether they should renovate their current home or sell up and move into another. Carly feels like she has had enough of their current house and longs to move into one with more space, but Phil, on the other hand, is content with their four-bed semi and its location.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree help British people making French castles their home or running businesses from them. The duo give Johnny a crash course in the dos and don'ts of chateau shopping before he and his wife start the search for their own dream place. Jonathan and Michael, who are struggling to turn their magnificent French castle into a money-making venture, explore some of their chateau's caves in the hope of finding a buried fortune. Plus, Phil and Angelina struggle to pitch their chateau as the perfect place for a 50th wedding anniversary party when they can't see eye to eye themselves.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of a dual-purpose family and wheelchair-friendly home built by design engineer and former Paralympic swimmer Mark Butler. Mark was paralysed from the waist down following a motorcycle accident and the home he currently lives in with his family makes it virtually impossible for him to complete even the simplest of tasks around the house. He and his wife Penny want to build a cutting-edge family home, with a drive-in basement, passenger lift and accessible kitchen and bathroom. However, building such a unique property proves a huge challenge, and the strain on Mark and Penny becomes almost unbearable.

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Cracks are starting to show during the height of the tourist season. With the summer sun burning down on freshly poured concrete, Sarah has to step in to stop it all falling apart.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow Lawrence, 26, who is rushed to St George's after being hit by a car while crossing the road on a night out in Eastbourne. Meanwhile, 53-year-old Katrina is brought to A&E after having difficulty breathing and experiencing chest pains that could indicate a heart attack.

programme.title: Swingers
programme.desc: Documentary about the scene in which people engage in group sex or swap sexual partners, going behind the scenes at one of Britain's most popular swingers' clubs on Valentines Day to find out what kinds of people attend and why.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Carly and Phil in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, who are unsure whether they should renovate their current home or sell up and move into another. Carly feels like she has had enough of their current house and longs to move into one with more space, but Phil, on the other hand, is content with their four-bed semi and its location.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree help British people making French castles their home or running businesses from them. The duo give Johnny a crash course in the dos and don'ts of chateau shopping before he and his wife start the search for their own dream place. Jonathan and Michael, who are struggling to turn their magnificent French castle into a money-making venture, explore some of their chateau's caves in the hope of finding a buried fortune. Plus, Phil and Angelina struggle to pitch their chateau as the perfect place for a 50th wedding anniversary party when they can't see eye to eye themselves.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of a dual-purpose family and wheelchair-friendly home built by design engineer and former Paralympic swimmer Mark Butler. Mark was paralysed from the waist down following a motorcycle accident and the home he currently lives in with his family makes it virtually impossible for him to complete even the simplest of tasks around the house. He and his wife Penny want to build a cutting-edge family home, with a drive-in basement, passenger lift and accessible kitchen and bathroom. However, building such a unique property proves a huge challenge, and the strain on Mark and Penny becomes almost unbearable.

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Cracks are starting to show during the height of the tourist season. With the summer sun burning down on freshly poured concrete, Sarah has to step in to stop it all falling apart.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow Lawrence, 26, who is rushed to St George's after being hit by a car while crossing the road on a night out in Eastbourne. Meanwhile, 53-year-old Katrina is brought to A&E after having difficulty breathing and experiencing chest pains that could indicate a heart attack.

programme.title: Swingers
programme.desc: Documentary about the scene in which people engage in group sex or swap sexual partners, going behind the scenes at one of Britain's most popular swingers' clubs on Valentines Day to find out what kinds of people attend and why.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead answer questions from fans across the globe, revealing the inner workings of the series as they look back at the last eight cars.

George Whitmore Jr was convicted of the crime, but later found to be innocent before Ricky Robles - the true killer - was identified.

programme.desc: The case of retired teacher Margaret Jack Sliger, shot dead in her farmyard in Mooresburg in May 2015. Kyle Robert Wolfe, a 15-year-old boy, later pleaded guilty to the crime.

programme.desc: In 1992, a small-time drug dealer was convicted of murdering a teenage boy. However, his sister and fiancee believe he is serving time for a crime he didn't commit.

programme.desc: Kate brings a bag of crystals to her appointment to help her say yes to the right dress. Tracey is going all out for an alternative wedding to her biker beau.

programme.desc: Jo and Al reunite with bride Joanna and her feisty dad at her final dress fitting. And, Kimberley's love of the fairytale Beauty and the Beast extends to a tattoo.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride Marta's mum and sister have flown in from Spain to see the final fitting, but, after breaking her ankle, can Jo and Al help Marta on her big day?.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Jonnie Peacock traces the story of his maternal grandfather, an amateur footballer scouted by a professional team but who bowed to parental pressure to take a proper job as a painter and decorator. Jonnie uncovers the legacy of poverty and disease that led the family to value job security over sport. On his father's side, Jonnie is captivated by the life of his great-great-great-great-grandmother, a strong woman prepared to stand up in court and testify against the men who had wronged her.

programme.title: Love/Hate

However, the kingpin makes it clear that his assistance will come at a hefty price - and Darren soon discovers his old colleague is far more dangerous than he used to be when he becomes embroiled in a drug deal with Fran. Crime drama, starring Robert Sheehan, Aidan Gillen, Ruth Bradley and Ruth Negga.

programme.title: Back
programme.desc: The Nichols family gathers together as Alison, Stephen's ex and the family lawyer, reveals what is in Laurie's will. Stephen is horrified to find out that Andrew has been left a five per cent share of the family business, the John Barleycorn pub. With the business already in debt, Stephen and Andrew battle to find the best way to make some extra cash. Meanwhile, Ellen decides that joining the church is the next logical step in her spiritual journey, and she and Julian the vicar get into some casual baptism.

However, the Citizens prevailed 6-3 when they last met the German outfit here in last season's group stage. Plus, highlights of FC Porto v Inter Milan.

programme.title: Country House Rescue
programme.desc: Ruth Watson heads to Kentchurch Court in Herefordshire, a stately home that has been owned by the Scudamore family since the 11th century. Current proprietor Jan Lucas-Scudamore has done her best to keep the finances under control, but with running costs of £120,000 a year, she appears to be fighting a losing battle. However, she is reluctant to take on Ruth's suggestion of opening the house to the public.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke returns with more projects to transform neglected historic buildings into unique homes. Russell Edwards and Nadia Smith have put everything into turning a derelict farmhouse in the Shropshire countryside into a family home. They are determined to restore the 18th-century building to its former glory, but their high standards soon cost them dearly, and after two winters in a caravan, illness and exhaustion threaten to overwhelm the pair. George helps with the design and hard graft and investigates the history behind this mysterious half-timber-framed building.

programme.title: Britain's Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts tells the story of Viking England by studying the history of York. She takes part in a Viking battle, meets the metal detectorists behind one of the UK's greatest archaeological finds and gets her hands on an almost 1,000-year-old poo. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout of York reflects its history.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Dudley in the West Midlands to Bridgnorth, Shropshire. He learns how Victorian blacksmithing was not for the faint-hearted, rides on one of Britain's most modern trains and traverses the Victoria Bridge at Bewdley in Worcestershire.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: After 14 decades centre stage the Manchester Town Hall is in urgent need of repair. Now a dedicated team are working hard to do this architectural giant justice.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: The work to upgrade London's Victorian sewer system, follow machines as they bore a network of tunnels linking Bazalgette's old sewer network to the Tideway Super-Sewer.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a wreck off the coast of Florida sends a team of underwater explorers on a mission to discover the identity of a ship that simply shouldn't exist.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring the Dew Drop Inn in New Orleans, a music mecca that dared to take on the authorities and paid the price, and Belgica Fort, built to defend an unlikely treasure.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore King's Cross St Pancras, including a secret siding and the disused Thameslink station.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. On the first leg, he helps feed the crew of Britain's newest battleship, discovers how the Victorians planned to repel a possible French invasion and learns there is a well-established industry in an unlikely location.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the third leg of his journey from London to Newton Abbot, Michael Portillo travels from Taunton to Minehead. Along the way he explores a church, finds out just what it takes to operate a 19th-century signal box and summons all his strength to move a 110-ton steam locomotive.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the penultimate leg of his journey Michael Portillo travels from Lynton to Exeter. He gets up close to a piece of natural history, visits a garden used as a viewing platform for public hangings and examines a timepiece like no other.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.
